title: FS Lots of T206s from lots of merged threads.
author: CMIZ5290

posts.post_title: FS Lots of T206s from lots of merged threads.
posts.post_content: One of the toughest HOFers to find in high grade, razor sharp corners. Card is centered approximately 65/35 left to right, very slight diamond cut, nothing distracting.  Spotless Pied 150 back. A PSA 7 of this card just sold for $5200 (very well centered). Priced at $3500 delivered with insurance. Price reduced to $3275, thanks.
Card available,...Thanks

posts.post_title: FS/FT: T206 Chase (Pink Port.) Old Mill SGC 30, extremely rare card. Only $399
posts.post_content: This is only one of two graded by SGC of all grades. PSA has only graded one of all grades. The other SGC card was graded a 40, and sold for $1495 at Sterling Auctions. Almost impossible front/back combo, for sale at  $695 delivered. Would consider possible T206 trades. price reduced to $575....Card reduced down to $495...Impossible front/back combo. Final shot, $399, this an absolute bargain...
Still available, impossible front/back combo. Would consider trades, thanks...
Price reduction, $575 delivered...thanks

One of the most striking color variations I have ever seen in 30 yrs of collecting, hands down. Bright purple with no questions whatsoever (please compare to other Collins). As a matter of fact, I have never seen a purple Collins.   Most color variations are red to a variance of orange, fairly common with T206s.  This card is extremely unique and a huge, huge exception.. This card is absolutely incredible, especially with all the back hoopla going on in the hobby. $2000 delivered, or best fair offer.. thanks
Ohhh nice Kev.  If I were a variation collector I'd be all over it.
Pink Chase still available, very rare front/back combo...thanks
Thanks for the nice comment, Collins still available, thanks...

posts.post_title: FS/FT: T206 Tinker (Port.) SGC 40 Bright Orange/Pink **SOLD**
posts.post_content: This is another color variation that's incredible. Card would probably grade an SGC 60 if not for the bottom right corner. Other than that corner, extremely solid card front and back. There have been a few recent color variations that have sold on auction for extremely high premiums that aren't as striking as this card. $950 delivered with insurance, trades considered...thanks, NOW $795 delivered...$499 buys it Tonight!! **SOLD**
reduction to $525 delivered...thanks
Price reduction, fabulous card, thanks...
I'll go to $495, bargain for this card.
Tinker available, thanks..
Reduced to $695...
Thought it was sold, but buyer did not come through. Card is available...
Available for $650 delivered, thanks
$575 buys the card. This is a tremendous color variation.
still available..
thanks..
PM sent....

Too rich for me, but wow, that is a gorgeous card.
Another try for Mordecai..

I know there's a reason but I don't know the reason behind the Elberfield Washington Portrait that makes it so valuable. Scarcity ? Traded ? 

Sorry I'm not here to make an offer but I love the Elberfield portraits just don't know the story behind the Washington portrait.

Josh

Elberfeld was very short printed. I believe that it is the rarest of the major cards in the set, behind demmitt and Ohara but ahead of all others IMO. 

Best
Scott 


Also this is one of the best samples I've seen. Great item!
Price listed for Collins, this is an extremely rare card. First I have ever seen for a true color variation....
